meanings.definition: To remove the shuck or husk from (corn, oysters, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She shucked the corn before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The chef shucked the oysters skillfully.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally shucked the corn too vigorously, and it flew everywhere!
meanings.sent4: The farmer shucked the corn with the precision of a surgeon.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the corn being shucked echoed through the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of (something)
meanings.sent1: He shucked the old clothes to make space in the closet.
meanings.sent2: The company shucked the outdated technology to upgrade.
meanings.sent3: She decided to shuck the broken vase rather than fixing it.
meanings.sent4: The decision to shuck the project was met with relief by the team.
meanings.sent5: The clutter was shucked away, leaving a clean and organized room.
